scopecontent.p: The fonds contains the articles of the Jewish Religious Community including changes from 1871 – 1933, file records, committee meetings records, election and personal files, register and financial administration files, and files of the Funeral Society. Financial books and files of affiliated communities of Mořina and Liteň are included. Preserved documents of the Jewish Religious Community Beroun describes the community administration from the half of the 19th century to 1930s, only Funeral Society book were kept from the first half of the 19th century. There is a larger unit of documents from the Nazi occupation period (1939 – 1942) such as the file records and the files continuing from the pre-war administration (religious and other various taxes, employee insurance and the social care), most importantly the documents connected to the persecution of the Jewish population, such as directives (mainly from the Jewish Religious Community in Prague), emigration files, files of housing and registration issues, employment questionnaires, various documents concerning the labour duty, travel permits and community mailing concerning the Jewish property records, issues of Jews of “non-Mosaic” religion, records of the seized objects from the Jewish property.

arrangement.p: The fond is processed, but not inventoried yet.

acqinfo.p: The documents were acquired by the Jewish Museum as part of the wartime shipment of artefacts and documents from Jewish Religious Communities liquidated during the Holocaust.
